reviews.text: This property is conveniently located to Hershey, which is why we stayed there. It was a one-night stay, which was good, because staying for a longer period might have been a bit more than I was prepared for.
reviews.title: Rooms are okay, but bring earplugs!

reviews.text: The good: This property is conveniently located to Harrisburg and Hershey. The room appeared clean, though somewhat dated. There is an indoor pool, spa, and workout room on site along with a self-service laundry. There is a restaurant on site.
reviews.title: rude staff

reviews.text: There have been other comments about the service. I didn't experience bad service here, but I can't say it was great either.
reviews.title: RUDEST front desk clerks EVER

reviews.text: The bad: We could hear EVERYTHING going on in the rooms next to ours, including conversations word-for-word. We could tell every time they flushed their toilets or opened/closed their doors. I don't know when I've been in a room with such thin walls. The halls and foyer near the pool smelled of cigarette smoke. The room was dated and a bit spartan. There were places where things had been patched and touched up with a different color of paint, evidence of old stains, etc. As I said above, it looked clean but it was also time for a remodel.
reviews.title: About what I expected..
Worst Experience Ever!!!
reviews.text: Overall I would probably seek out another option the next time in the area.

reviews.title: Not a bad choice
reviews.text: Spent the night on July 6th, 2004. Pool was nice and hotel room was alright. (The rug needed to be cleaned though.) They gave out vouchers for breakfast at the resturant, which was good. The drive was 10 minutes to Hershey park, so location was decent and less expensive then the closer hotels. All the staff was extremely polite and helpful.

reviews.title: Highly recommend this hotel!!!
reviews.text: We recently stayed at this Best Western Hotel, and I was extremely

reviews.title: Enjoyable, especially good for family with kids
reviews.text: pleased... The rooms were spacious and extra clean. (NO motel smell). 2

I stayed at the Best Western Harrisburg August 2005 with a group of family and friends while we visited Hershey Park and Lancaster outlets. The hotel met our expectations. It was clean and comfortable. I was in a King Suite. Very spacious. Nice jacuzzi tub and fireplace. The others had double queen rooms with microwaves and refrigerators and were satisfied with their rooms as well. The pool was great, especially for the kids. The adults enjoyed the whirlpool. The food at the Country Oven next door was good for breakfast. Planning another stay there in May 2006.(Couldn't stand the crowds in Hershey Park in August!!)
reviews.title: Met My Expectations

reviews.text: I stayed at the Best Western with my family for a two night stay. This was my children's first experience staying overnight in a hotel. I booked a King Suite because they have a microwave and refrigerator in the room plus a fold out sofa bed which I thought would be nice rather than always sitting on a bed to watch TV. We arrived around 2:30, and the desk clerk told me our room was not ready, but would be ready around 3-3:15. We sat in the car while we waited, and came back in at 3:15, at which time the room was ready, but the clerk was helping someone else. She didn't even acknowlege that I was standing and waiting, which I didn't like--could have at least said she'd be right with me. Another woman showed up behind the desk, and helped me. She asked me if we wanted a room by the pool or on the 2nd floor, which was nice that she gave us options. I chose the second floor location because I figured the pool might get a bit loud--it's open until 10pm. The clerk gave me breakfast coupons for the restaurant for all of us, and a coupon for a free drink or dessert. She told me that the coupons would be good for both days of our stay--which they were not. I did have to return to the desk for tickets for the next day.
reviews.title: OK-nothing great nothing horrible
It's definitely a 2 star hotel
reviews.text: The room was clean--could use new carpets and decor. The microwave could also have been cleaner, but we ended up never using it. The towels are small and we were 4 people in the room--only got 3 bath towels. I could have called for another one I'm sure, but I just made the kids share--no biggie. They had a iron and ironing board, hairdryer, and coffee maker (which you'll never need because there is free coffee 24 hours a day in the lobby--only non dairy creamers though so I bought 1/2 and 1/2 and put it in the fridge). I had to make up the sofa bed, we needed to search for the sheets (which we found in the drawers with a pillow, and blanket)--other pillow was on the king bed. Sheets were ripped and there was no fitted sheet--just two flat--again, no biggie.
